titleStmt.title: D. Eckert et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7573

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency
Jas T. Bramlette
Govr of Kentucky
Sir

Your petitioners would respectfully represent that on the 5th day of Novr 1866 a fine ^of $25 -- ^ was assessed against S. Gruber in the City Court, of Louisville, and we respectfully urge its remission being satisfied that his cause and circumstances merit the interposition of Executive Clemency & we will ever pray &c

D. Eckert.
W Maxey
Chas H L Meyer
S Parker
Jos. W. Putnam
John Donnelly
Wm Gawler
Johan Welker
Franz Walter
Gustave Rainhoskaty
Frank Linn
Jacob Flasck
Capt. L. B. Preuss.
C. SÃ¼bel
Fred Theobold
L Jacques
Henry Schnader
F. J. Volpert
A. S. Henneberger
Adam Atsinger
John Kirk
Thomas Geraghty
Johan Schatrel
H C Thomas
Thomas Slater
W K Thomas
A Rammers
F. W. Quarte

Louisville City Crt
vs
S. Gruber
$25
